start.speaker: Rill
start.text:
Water doesn’t keep secrets. It moves them.

If you want me along, you learn to choose routes that don’t drown someone else.

choices.text: Come with me. We’ll cross clean.

end.speaker: Narrator
end.text: Rill checks the waterline like it’s a ledger. She doesn’t smile much, but her attention is its own kind of kindness.
